intro: Rohria ilicifolia, commonly known as the shrub-leaf holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, particularly in Nepal, India, and Bhutan. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with small, leathery leaves that are densely packed on its branches. It produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by bright red berries in the autumn. Rohria ilicifolia is often found in rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in cool and moist environments.
